Private contract of purchase and sale of establishment and brands

I, the undersigned, Urbano José Afonso, declare that I have fairly contracted with Mr. Julião Castro the sale of my estancia establishment, located on the coast of Canhitas, with about a league and a half of land more or less, in the department of Salto, in the Eastern State, with all the cattle, horses, mules and any others that are considered to be my property, existing on the land of which I am possessed, under the conditions mentioned below:

- From today onwards Mr. Julião Castro will be the buyer, lord and possessor of the brands belonging to my establishment and of my property here and anywhere where there is any animal belonging to said brands, under the warranty of the sale I made to him of them.
- That I, as seller and resident in Brazil, shall have the right and power to recruit the animals belonging to said brands existing in the province of Rio Grande do Sul, for a period of six months, and to rebrand them; and when I do not comply with this, at the end of said period, I will lose the right.
- That the brands I sell are the following, namely: mine and that of my son Antônio José Afonso, and I am responsible for my son’s brand in case there is the slightest doubt about it.
- That the sale of the brands and all the animals belonging to them was agreed for eight hundred pesos of silver, obligating Mr. Julião Castro, as buyer, to make the first payment on sight of the amount of four hundred and twenty-three pesos, which I have already received upon making this, and three hundred and seventy-seven pesos at the term of five months, by a promissory note signed by him at said term.
- That if by chance the buyer Julião Castro has occasion to make any profit from cattle by selling them for the charqueada or to any other place understood with the same purpose, he will be obliged — except for the term I give him — to comply with the said payment, even if the said term is not due.
- The buyer Julião Castro is obliged to strictly comply with the provisions mentioned below, namely: to deliver to me or to my order six branded mules or above, as well as twelve mares under the same condition, when I or my order seek them; as well as six colts, including one bay brown herdsman among them; as well as he shall give, by my order, of which I reserve, the following: to Mr. Nazário Verão four male cattle; to Mr. Valdomiro Sousa, two said; to Manuel Moreira de Miranda, one colt; to Mr. Filipe Rodrigues, one idem; as well as to Mrs. Maria Moreira da Silva a bay oveiro colt, from the known Baios herd.
- That, from this day forward, I lose as seller the right to the assets that by this contract I sell to Mr. Julião Castro, he being obligated to answer with his person and goods possessed and to be possessed, for the prompt payment and execution of the aforesaid, as well as I to make the sale firm and valid for him, both in court and out of it, notwithstanding third parties.

For thus being fair and contracted, we draw up two documents of this same content and entirely equal, to which we give as much force and effect as if it were a public deed, and for certainty of truth we sign with the witnesses declared below.

Done in Arapey Chico, on September 18, 1848.

Urbano José Afonso Julião Castro  
As witnesses Manuel Ferreira Bica Justino Bernardes de Castro  
As witness who made and signed this Manuel Moreira de Miranda
